tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
Is coding in your blood?

Are you eager to fight your way through a group of geeks or a parliament of programmers?
Are you ready to do anything to show the world that you are the best in the arena of Programming?

Then prove your coding prowess in this brand new battleground for coders - Ninja Coding

tabs.title: Format
tabs.content:
ROUND 1:

»  Standard debugging, coding and reverse coding questions in C/C++/Java.
»  Debugging questions from C/C++/Java
»  Round duration will be 1 hour.
»  15 teams will be selected for the next round.

ROUND 2 & ROUND 3:

»  Street coding. Format will be revealed on the spot

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Each team should strictly consist of 2 members.
» The members of a team can be from different colleges/institutions.
» All participants must have their k! IDs to participate.
» You will need to present a valid college ID card for the general registration.
» Usage of mobile phones and PDAs are strictly prohibited.
» No contestant can be a member of more than one team.
» Teams involved in any kind of malpractice will be immediately disqualified.
» The organisers' decisions will be final and binding.

tabs.title: Time and Venue
tabs.content:
Prelims: 

Date: 18th Feb

Time: 3.00 PM to 5.00 PM

Venue: KP Halls 301-309

Finals:

Date: 19th Feb

Time: 3.00 PM to 6.00 PM

Venue: Opposite to Printing Department WiFi Hut
